intro: Frangula marahuacensis, commonly known as the Mexican buckthorn, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes plants such as citrus and rue. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that turns red when mature. Frangula marahuacensis is adapted to dry conditions and has a deep root system to access groundwater.
